elaborationOutcomeImpactStatement:
With AICCRA 's technical support on AgData Hub development, for the first time, ANACIM (Agence Nationale de l'Aviation Civile et de la Météorologie) in collaboration with the International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI) and Columbia University (IRI) is rendering weather forecast based district level for agrometeorological advisory service in a seamless way (1). This collaboration also led to high-quality bias corrected sub-seasonal and seasonal predictions integrated in the platform. Meanwhile the process was bolstering with a data entry campaign supported by AICCRA, which considerably reduced the large gaps in terms of hourly data available, particularly for manually collected data from 1947 to 2020 and in thirteen districts (2).

AgData Hub provides advanced weather information through efficient delivery mechanism of the information which ultimately enables the multidisciplinary group (GTP) members to provide crop specific agromet advisories to the farmers (3). Before intervention, local GTP bulletins were centralized to form aggregated data, which are then used to produce the national GTP bulletin. The transfer of information between national and local GTPs was generally done by e-mail, and aggregation by hand (4). With the digitalization process, a mobile AgData Hub app ensures seamless data collection with a multilingual interface that facilitates diverse user engagement, minimizing errors and enabling real-time data uploads to a cloud-based system (5,6). As stated by a local GTP member of Goudiry district (Eastern Senegal), the application is reshaping the way the on-season bulletins are produced: “GTP bulletins [are produced] simply by filling in the data inside [the application]. In fact, the work could even be done remotely” (3). Through this process, AgData Hub is now equipped with real time feedback or weekly feedback on weather forecast and advisory in provided format on weekly basis. The module is customized to report for location (at the national and state level), for type of crop and stage of crop growth. User-centered design, interaction, and cognitive aspects added to the design of climate information visualizations reduce the cognitive load of users during tasks performance, thus improving user experience (7).
AgData Hub, launched in May 2023, is now hosted on ANACIM server and embedded within the multidisciplinary working group GTPS's website. His interface is complemented by latest user guidelines (8). The system has been operational for use by 32 decision-makers and experts at the ministry of agriculture, 149 GTP members and 28 experts of community of Practice as powerful tool, tailored to their needs (9,10,11).
cgiarInnovation:
AgData Hub 
AgData Hub brings together the data eco-system necessary to support blending of climate science and agriculture through technology and partnerships. It develops and disseminates CIS and agro-advisories to farmers by consolidating information from multiple players, processes into a usable format to be shared with target end users. It will be hosted by Smart Zambia Institute (Zambia), KALRO (Kenya) and ANACIM (Senegal) in the three AICCRA countries.

Dhulipala R, Joseph JE, Konte O, Faye A, Worou N, Whitbread A. 2022. Catalyzing the use of climate information in agriculture decision making through datahubs. AICCRA Info note. Accelerating Impacts of CGIAR Climate Research for Africa (AICCRA). https://hdl.handle.net/10568/125543

performanceIndicator: ["(2024-2025) PDO Indicator 1: Partners and stakeholders in the Project area increasingly accessing enhanced climate information services and/or validated climate-smart agriculture indicators (Numbers)​","(2024-2025) IPI 2.1: Climate advisory platforms/ hubs launched/ strengthened, including their focus on gender and social inclusion (Number)"]
title: AgData Hub’s digital portal streamlines production of climate data by Senegal’s national meteorological agency, ANACIM
outcomeImpactStatement: An evolution in the delivery methods of CIS in Senegal with ANACIM was achieved through the: (a) launch of an AgData Hub embedded within the multidisciplinary working group (GTP) portal (an information portal for the GTP) speeding up the process of data collection allowing for remote interaction among members;  (b) monitoring of extension activities with timely and efficient feedback; (c) digitalization of weather station data to increase historical data availability for climatic models; and (d) improvement of user experience.
strategicOutcome: SO1: Priority countries adopt policies and build capacity to improve dietary diversity and diet quality of consumers.

stageStudy: Level 2 - (sphere of influence) CGIAR research (and related activities) has contributed to documented policy and practice change by key actors.  This may include changes such as income, nutrient intake etc. in the sphere of influence (e.g. project level).  Example of evidence: a study of adoption and effects, commissioned at project level.
